description: Number of primes having exactly same digits as appear in first n primes.
comments: a(n) = 0 if sum of digits is a multiple of three (see A103208). - Chandler
example: a(4)=8 because the first three prime n, concatenated, are 2+3+5+7 or 2357. There are 8 prime arrangements: 2357 2753 3257 3527 5237 5273 7253 7523.
author: _Enoch Haga_, Mar 19 2000
